1.verse: Samaria and Israel to Be Punished - During the time that Jotham [ruled 758–743 BC], Ahaz [ruled 743–727 BC], and Hezekiah [ruled 727–698 BC] were kings of Judah, the word of the LORD came to Micah, who was from Moresheth [a town in southern Judah]. He saw these visions about Samaria and Jerusalem.

2.verse: Hear this, all you ·nations [peoples]; listen, earth and all you who live on it. The Lord GOD will ·be a witness [bring charges] against you, the Lord from his Holy Temple.

3.verse: See, the LORD is coming out of his place; he is coming down to ·walk on [tread upon] the ·tops of the mountains [heights of the earth].

4.verse: The mountains will melt under him, and the valleys will ·crack open [split apart], like wax near a fire, like water running down a hillside.

5.verse: All this is because of Jacob’s ·sin [rebellion; transgression], because of the sins of the ·nation [house] of Israel. What is ·the place of Jacob’s sin [Jacob’s trangression]? Isn’t it Samaria [the capital of the northern empire]? What is Judah’s ·place of idol worship [high place; a pagan worship site]? Isn’t it Jerusalem [Judah’s sin made the temple in Jerusalem no better than a pagan temple]?

6.verse: The Lord Speaks - “So I will make Samaria a ·pile [heap] of ruins in the open country, a place for planting vineyards. I will pour her stones down into the valley and ·strip her down to [lay bare; uncover] her foundations.

7.verse: All her ·idols [carved images] will be broken into pieces; all the ·gifts to her idols [prostitute’s wages] will be burned with fire. I will ·destroy [make desolate] all her idols, and because Samaria ·earned her money [or gathered these things] by ·being unfaithful to me [prostituting herself], ·this money will be carried off by others who are not faithful to me [to the pay of the prostitute they will return; Samaria’s wealth earned through idolatry would now go to the pagan temples of Assyria—one prostitute’s wages going to another].”

8.verse: Micah’s Great Sadness - I will ·moan and cry [mourn and wail] because of this evil, going around barefoot and naked. I will ·cry loudly [wail] like ·the wild dogs [jackals] and ·make sad sounds [moan] like the ·owls [or ostriches] do,

9.verse: because Samaria’s wound ·cannot be healed [is incurable]. It ·will spread [or has spread] to Judah; it ·will reach [or has reached] the city gate of my people [where the city’s affairs were conducted], all the way to Jerusalem.

10.verse: Don’t tell it in Gath [sounds like Hebrew for “tell”; Gath and the cities in this list were in Assyria’s path of destruction in 701 BC]. Don’t cry ·in Acco [or at all; the Hebrew for “cry” sounds like Acco]. Roll in the dust at Beth Ophrah [“house of dust”].

11.verse: Pass on your way, naked and ashamed, you who live in Shaphir [“beautiful” or “pleasant”]. Those who live in Zaanan [sounds like Hebrew for “come out”] won’t come out. The people in Beth Ezel [“house of nearness”] ·will cry [are in mourning], but they will not give you any support.

12.verse: Those who live in Maroth [sounds like Hebrew for “sad” or “miserable”] ·will be anxious [hope] for good news to come, because ·trouble [disaster] ·will [or has] come from the LORD, all the way to the gate of Jerusalem.

13.verse: You people living in Lachish [a large town in Judah; Lachish sounds like the Hebrew for “horse” or “steed”], harness the fastest ·horses [steeds] to the chariot. ·Jerusalem’s [Daughter of Zion’s; the location of the Temple] sins ·started in [began with] you; yes, Israel’s ·sins [transgressions; rebellion] were found in you.

14.verse: So you must give ·farewell gifts [a dowry] to Moresheth in Gath. The houses in Aczib [“deception”] ·will be false help to [or have deceived/betrayed] the kings of Israel.

15.verse: I will bring against you people who will ·take [possess; conquer] your land, you who live in Mareshah [sounds like Hebrew for “conqueror”]. The ·glory [or nobles; leaders] of Israel will go in to Adullam [perhaps to hide in its caves].

16.verse: ·Cut off your hair [Shave your head; Make yourself bald; a sign of mourning or sadness] for the children ·you love [in whom you delight]. Make yourself bald like the eagle, because your children will be taken away ·to a foreign land [in exile/captivity].

1.verse: The Evil Plans of People - ·How terrible it will be for people [Woe to those] who plan wickedness, who lie on their beds and make evil plans. When the morning light comes, they do what they planned, because they have the power to do so.

2.verse: They ·want [covet] fields, so they take them; they ·want [covet] houses, so they ·take them away [seize them]. They ·cheat [defraud; oppress] people to get their houses; they rob them even of their ·property [inheritance].

3.verse: That is why the LORD says: “Look, I am planning ·trouble [disaster] against such people, ·and you won’t be able to save yourselves [from which you cannot remove your necks; like a yoke]. You will no longer walk ·proudly [arrogantly], because it will be a ·terrible time [time of calamity/catastrophe/evil].

4.verse: ·At that time [In that day] people will ·make fun of [ridicule; sing a taunt against] you and ·sing this sad song [lament with a lamentation] about you: ‘We are completely ·ruined [destroyed]; the LORD has taken away my people’s ·land [possession; inheritance]. Yes, he has taken it away from me and divided our fields among ·our enemies [renegades; or the traitors]!’”

5.verse: So you will have no one from the LORD’s ·people [assembly] to throw lots to divide the land.

6.verse: Micah Is Asked Not to Prophesy - The ·prophets [or preachers] say, “Don’t ·prophesy [or preach] to us! Don’t ·prophesy [preach] about these things! ·Nothing to make us feel bad will happen [Disgrace/Humiliation will not overtake us]!”

7.verse: But I must say this, ·people [house] of Jacob: ·The LORD is becoming angry [or Does not the LORD grow impatient…?] about what you have done. ·My words are welcome [or Are not my words good…?] to the person who ·does what is right [walks uprightly].

8.verse: But ·you are fighting against my people like an enemy [or my people have risen up against me as an enemy]. You ·take the coats [strip off the rich robe] from people who pass by peacefully; ·you plan war [or …like men returning from war].

9.verse: You have ·forced [cast out; evicted] the women of my people from their ·nice [pleasant] houses; you have taken my glory from their children forever.

10.verse: ·Get up [Arise] and leave. This is not your place of rest anymore. You have made this place ·unclean [defiled], and it is doomed to destruction.

11.verse: ·But you people want a false prophet who will tell you nothing but lies [If a man, coming as wind/spirit and lies, should lie to you…]. You want one who ·promises to prophesy good things for you if you give him wine and beer [or will prophesy wine and beer for you]. He’s just the prophet for you.

12.verse: The Lord Promises to Rescue His People - “Yes, ·people of Jacob [Jacob], I will ·bring [assemble] all of you together; I will bring together ·all those left alive in [the remnant of] Israel. I will put them together like sheep in a pen, like a flock in its pasture; the place will be filled with ·many people [or a noisy crowd].

13.verse: Someone will ·open the way [break out] and ·lead the people out [go up before them]. The people will break through the gate and ·leave the city where they were held captive [go out]. Their king will ·go out in front of [pass through before] them, and the LORD will lead them.”

1.verse: The Leaders of Israel Are Guilty of Evil - Then I said, “Listen, leaders of ·the people of Jacob [Jacob]; listen, you rulers of the ·nation [house] of Israel. ·You should [Should you not…?] know ·how to decide cases fairly [justice],

2.verse: but you hate good and love evil. You skin my people alive and tear the flesh off their bones.

3.verse: You ·eat [devour] my people’s flesh and skin them and break their bones; you chop them up like meat for the pot, like meat in a cooking pan.

4.verse: Then they will cry to the LORD, but he won’t answer them. At that time he will hide his face from them, because what they have done is evil.”

5.verse: The LORD says this about the prophets who ·teach his people the wrong way of living [mislead/lead astray my people]: “If these prophets are given food to eat, they shout, ‘Peace!’ But if someone doesn’t ·give them what they ask for [place food in their mouths], they ·call for a holy war [declare war] against that person.

6.verse: So it will become like night for them, without visions [revelation from God will cease]. It will become dark for them, without ·any way to tell the future [divination]. The sun is about to set for the prophets; their day will become dark.

7.verse: The seers [another name for prophets] will be ashamed; the ·people who see the future [diviners] will be ·embarrassed [disgraced; humiliated]. Yes, all of them will cover their ·mouths [or lips; or faces], because there will be no answer from God.”

8.verse: Micah Is an Honest Prophet of God - But I am filled with power, with the Spirit of the LORD, and with justice and ·strength [might], to ·tell the people of Jacob [declare to Jacob] ·how they have turned against God [his transgression], and ·the people of Israel [Israel] how they have sinned.

9.verse: Leaders of [the house of] Jacob and rulers of [the house of] Israel, listen to me, you who hate ·fairness [justice] and ·twist [pervert; distort] what is ·right [straight].

10.verse: You build ·Jerusalem [Zion; the location of the Temple] ·by murdering people [with bloodshed]; you build it with ·evil [wickedness; iniquity].

11.verse: Its ·judges take money to decide who wins in court [rulers judge for a bribe]. Its priests only teach for ·pay [a price], and its prophets ·only look into the future when they get paid [tell fortunes/practice divination for money]. But they lean on the LORD and say, “The LORD is here with us, so ·nothing bad [no harm] will ·happen to [overtake; come upon] us.”

12.verse: [Therefore] Because of you, Jerusalem will be plowed like a field. ·The city [Zion; v. 10] will become a ·pile of rocks [heap of rubble/ruins], and the ·hill [mountain] ·on which the Temple stands [of the house] will be ·covered with bushes [an overgrown hill; wooded heights].

1.verse: The Mountain of the Lord - In the last days the mountain ·on which the LORD’s Temple stands [of the house of the LORD] will become the ·most important [head] of all mountains. It will be raised above the hills, and people from other nations will come streaming to it.

2.verse: Many nations will come and say, “Come, let us go up to the mountain of the LORD, to the ·Temple [house] of the God of Jacob, so that he can teach us his ways, and we can ·obey his teachings [walk in his paths].” His ·teachings [instruction; law; Torah] will go out from ·Jerusalem [Zion], the word of the LORD from ·that city [Jerusalem].

3.verse: The Lord will ·judge [or arbitrate between] many nations; he will ·make decisions about [settle disputes between] strong nations that are far away. They will ·hammer [beat] their swords into ·plow blades [plowshares] and their spears into ·hooks for trimming trees [pruning hooks; Is. 2:4; Joel 3:10]. Nations will no longer raise swords against other nations; they will not train for war anymore.

4.verse: Everyone will sit under his own grapevine and fig tree [symbols of prosperity], and no one will make him afraid, because the LORD ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] has said it.

5.verse: All other nations ·may follow [walk in the name of] their own gods, but we will ·follow [walk in the name of] the LORD our God forever and ever.

6.verse: The LORD says, “·At that time [In that day], I will gather the ·crippled [lame]; I will ·bring together [assemble; gather] ·those who were sent away [the outcast/exile], those whom I ·caused to have trouble [afflicted; filled with grief].

7.verse: I will ·keep alive those who were crippled [make the lame a remnant], and I will make a strong nation of those who were ·sent away [outcasts; exiles]. The LORD will ·be their king [reign over them] in Mount Zion from now on and forever.

8.verse: And you, ·watchtower of the flocks [or Migdal-eder], ·hill [or stronghold] of ·Jerusalem [Daughter Zion], to you ·will come the kingdom [dominion will be restored] as in the past. ·Jerusalem [Daughter Jerusalem], the ·right to rule [kingship; sovereignty] will come again to you.”

9.verse: Why the Israelites Must Go to Babylon - Now, why do you cry so loudly? ·Is your king gone [Have you no king/King; either a human king or God]? Have you lost your ·helper [counselor; wise guide], so that you are in pain, like a woman ·trying to give birth [in labor]?

10.verse: ·People of Jerusalem [Daughter Zion], ·strain and be in pain [writhe and groan]. Be like a woman ·trying to give birth [in labor], because now you must leave the city and live in the field. You will go to Babylon, but you will be ·saved [rescued] from that place. The LORD will go there and ·buy you back [redeem you] from [the hand of] your enemies.

11.verse: But now many nations have ·come to fight [gathered; assembled] against you, saying, “·Let’s destroy Jerusalem [Let her be defiled/desecrated]. We will ·look at her and be glad we have defeated [gloat over; let our eye look upon] ·her [Zion].”

12.verse: But they don’t know ·what the LORD is thinking [the thoughts of the LORD]; they don’t understand his plan. He has gathered them like ·bundles of grain [sheaves] to the threshing floor.

13.verse: “Get up and ·beat them [thresh], ·people of Jerusalem [Daughter Zion]. I will make you ·strong as if you had horns of iron [horns of iron] and hoofs of bronze. You will beat many nations into small pieces and ·give [devote; consecrate] their ·wealth [gains; spoils] to the LORD, their ·treasure [wealth] to the Lord of all the earth.”

1.verse: So, ·strong city [daughter of troops], ·gather [marshal; muster] your ·soldiers [troops] together, because we are ·surrounded and attacked [besieged]. They will ·hit [strike] the ·leader [ruler; judge] of Israel ·in the face [on the cheek] with a ·club [rod; or scepter].

2.verse: The Ruler to Be Born in Bethlehem - “But you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, though you are ·too small to be [or small; insignificant] among the ·army groups from [clans of] Judah, from you will come one who will rule Israel for me [the Messiah; Is. 9:1–7; 11:1–16; Matt. 2:6]. ·He comes [His origins are; His goings out are] from ·very old [ancient] times, from days long ago.”

3.verse: The LORD will ·give up [abandon] his people until the one who is ·having a baby [in labor] gives birth; then the rest of his ·relatives [brothers] will return to the people of Israel.

4.verse: At that time ·the ruler of Israel [he] will stand and ·take care of his people [shepherd his flock] with the LORD’s strength and with the ·power [majesty] of the name of the LORD his God. ·The Israelites [They] will live in safety, because his greatness will reach ·all over [to the ends of] the earth.

5.verse: Rescue and Punishment - He will ·bring [be] peace. ·Assyria will surely [or When the Assyrians…; or If the Assyrians should…] come into our ·country [land] and ·walk over [march through] our ·large buildings [fortresses]. We will ·set up [raise against them] seven shepherds [symbolic of completeness], eight ·leaders [princes] of the people.

6.verse: They will ·destroy [or rule; shepherd] the Assyrians with their swords; they will ·conquer [or rule; shepherd] the land of ·Assyria [Nimrod; a famous hunter, said to have founded Assyria; Gen. 10:8–9] ·with their swords drawn [or at its gates]. They will rescue us from the Assyrians when they come into our land, when they ·walk [march] over our borders.

7.verse: Then the ·people of Jacob who are left alive [remnant of Jacob] will be ·to other [in the midst of many] people like dew from the LORD or ·rain [showers] on the grass— it does not wait for human beings; it does not pause for ·any person [the sons/children of man/Adam].

8.verse: ·Those of Jacob’s people who are left alive [The remnant of Jacob] will be scattered among many nations and [in the midst of many] peoples. They will be like a lion among the animals of the forest, like a young lion in a flock of sheep: As it goes, it jumps on them and tears them to pieces, and no one can ·save [rescue] them.

9.verse: So ·you will raise your fist in victory [your hand will be lifted] over your ·enemies [adversaries], and all your enemies will be ·destroyed [cut off].

10.verse: The LORD says, “·At that time [In that day], I will ·take [cut off; destroy] your horses from you and destroy your chariots.

11.verse: I will destroy the cities in your ·country [land] and tear down all your ·defenses [strongholds; fortresses].

12.verse: I will ·take away [destroy] ·the magic charms you use [your sorcery/witchcraft] so you will have no more fortune-tellers.

13.verse: I will destroy your ·statues of gods [carved images] and the stone pillars you worship so that you will no longer ·worship [bow down to] what your hands have made.

14.verse: I will ·tear down [uproot your] ·Asherah idols [Asherahs; sacred trees or poles dedicated to the goddess Asherah] from you and destroy your cities.

15.verse: In my anger and ·rage [wrath], I will ·pay back [seek vengeance on] the nations that have not ·listened [obeyed].”

1.verse: The Lord’s Case - Now hear what the LORD says: “Get up; plead ·your [or my] case in front of the mountains; let the hills hear your ·story [voice].

2.verse: Mountains, listen to the LORD’s ·legal case [accusation; indictment]. ·Strong [Enduring] foundations of the earth, listen. The LORD has a ·legal case [accusation; indictment] against his people, and he will ·accuse [contend with] Israel.”

3.verse: He says, “My people, what did I do to you? How ·did I make you tired of me [have I wearied you]? ·Tell [Answer] me.

4.verse: I brought you from the land of Egypt [Ex. 12:51] and ·freed [redeemed] you from slavery; I sent Moses, Aaron, and Miriam [Ex. 15:20] to you.

5.verse: My people, remember the evil plans of Balak king of Moab [Num. 22:5] and what Balaam son of Beor told Balak [Num. 22–24]. Remember what happened from Acacia to Gilgal [Josh. 3:1; 4:19–24] so that you will know the ·LORD does what is right [righteousness/justice of the LORD]!”

6.verse: You say, “What can I bring with me when I come before the LORD, when I bow before ·God on high [the exalted God]? Should I come before him with burnt offerings [Lev. 1:1–17], with year-old calves?

7.verse: Will the LORD be pleased with a thousand ·male sheep [rams]? Will he be pleased with ten thousand rivers of oil? Should I give my ·first child [firstborn] for ·the evil I have done [my transgression]? Should I give ·my very own child [the fruit of my body] for ·my sin [the sin of my soul]?”

8.verse: The LORD has told you, ·human [O man], what is good; he has told you what ·he wants [the LORD requires] from you: to do what is ·right to other people [just], love ·being kind to others [mercy; lovingkindness], and ·live humbly, obeying [walk humbly with] your God.

9.verse: The voice of the LORD ·calls [cries out] to the city, and ·the wise person [wisdom] ·honors him [sees/acknowledges his name]. So ·pay attention [listen] to the ·rod of punishment [rod]; pay attention to the One who ·threatens to punish [appointed it].

10.verse: Are there still in the wicked house wicked treasures and the cursed false measure?

11.verse: Can I forgive people who cheat others with ·wrong [wicked] weights and [deceptive] scales [Prov. 11:1]?

12.verse: The rich people of the city ·do cruel things [are full of violence]. Its people tell lies; ·they do not tell the truth [their tongues in their mouths are deceitful].

13.verse: As for me, I will make you sick. I will ·attack [strike] you, ruining you because of your sins.

14.verse: You will eat, but you won’t ·become full [be satisfied]; you will still be hungry and empty. You will store up, but save nothing, and what you store up, ·the sword will destroy [I will give to the sword].

15.verse: You will plant, but you won’t harvest. You will ·step on your [press; tread] olives, but you won’t ·get any oil from them [anoint yourself with oil]. You will ·crush [tread] the grapes, but you will not drink the new wine.

16.verse: This is because you ·obey [keep; observe] the ·laws [statutes] of King Omri [a wicked king of Israel; 1 Kin. 16:25, 26] and do all the things that Ahab’s family does [another wicked king of Israel; 1 Kin. 16:30–33; 21:25, 26]; you follow their ·advice [or traditions; policies]. So I will ·let you be destroyed [make you a desolation]. The people in your city will be ·laughed at [taunted; a hissing], and other nations will ·make fun of [mock] you.

1.verse: The Evil That People Do - ·Poor [Woe to] me! I am like a hungry man, and all the summer fruit has been picked— there are no grapes left to eat, none of the early figs I ·love [crave].

2.verse: All of the faithful people ·are gone [have perished from the land/earth]; there is not one ·good [upright] person left in this country. Everyone ·is waiting to kill someone [lies in wait for blood]; everyone ·is trying to trap someone else [hunts his brother with a net].

3.verse: With both hands they are doing evil. Rulers ask for ·money [gifts], and judges’ decisions are bought for a ·price [bribe]. ·Rich [Influential; Great] people ·tell what they want [make demands], and they get it.

4.verse: Even the best of them is like a ·thornbush [brier]; the most ·honest [upright] of them is worse than a ·prickly plant [thorn hedge]. The day ·that your watchmen warned you about [of your watchmen; the coming exile predicted by the prophets] has come. Now they will be confused [without the guidance of the prophets].

5.verse: Don’t ·believe [trust] your neighbor or ·trust [put confidence in] a friend. ·Don’t say anything [Guard the doors of your mouth], even to ·your wife [the one who lies on your bosom].

6.verse: A son will not honor his father, a daughter will ·turn against [defy; rise up against] her mother, and a daughter-in-law will be against her mother-in-law; a person’s enemies will be ·members of his own family [or the servants of his household; the men/people of his house; Matt. 10:36].

7.verse: The Lord’s Kindness - Israel says, “I will look to the LORD for help. I will wait for God ·to save me [my savior]; my God will hear me.

8.verse: Enemy, don’t ·laugh at [gloat over] me. I have fallen, but I will get up again. I sit in ·the shadow of trouble now [darkness], but the LORD will be a light for me.

9.verse: I sinned against the LORD, so ·he was angry with me [I will bear the wrath of the LORD], but he will ·defend my case in court [plead my case]. He will ·bring about what is right [accomplish justice] for me. Then he will bring me out into the light, and I will see ·him set things right [his righteousness/justice/vindication].

10.verse: Then my enemies will see this, and they will be ·ashamed [covered wth shame], those who said to me, ‘Where is the LORD your God?’ I will ·look down on [gloat over] them. They will ·get walked on [be trampled down], like mud in the street.”

11.verse: Israel Will Return - The ·time [day] will come when your walls will be built again, when your ·country will grow [borders will be extended].

12.verse: ·At that time [In that day] your people will come back to you from Assyria and the cities of Egypt, and from Egypt to the ·Euphrates River [River], and from sea to sea and mountain to mountain.

13.verse: The earth will be ·ruined [desolate] ·for [or because of] the people who live in it ·because [for the fruit] of their deeds.

14.verse: A Prayer to God - So shepherd your people with your ·stick [shepherd’s staff]; tend the flock of ·people who belong to you [your inheritance/possession]. That flock now lives alone in the forest in the middle of ·a garden land [pasturelands; or Carmel]. Let them ·feed [graze] in Bashan and Gilead as in days long ago.

15.verse: “As in the days when I brought you out of Egypt, I will show them ·miracles [wonders].”

16.verse: When the nations see those miracles, they will ·no longer brag [be ashamed/disappointed] about their power. They will put their hands over their mouths, ·refusing to listen [and their ears will be deaf].

17.verse: They will ·crawl in the [lick] dust like a snake, like ·insects crawling [or serpents; crawling things] on the ground. They will come trembling from their ·holes [or strongholds] to the LORD our God and will turn in fear before you.

18.verse: There is no God like you. You forgive those who are guilty of sin; you ·don’t look at the sins [pass over the transgressions] of ·your people who are left alive [the remnant of your inheritance]. You will not stay angry forever, because you ·enjoy [delight in] ·being kind [mercy; lovingkindness].

19.verse: You will have ·mercy [compassion] on us again; you will conquer our sins. You will ·throw away [hurl; cast] all our sins into the ·deepest part [depths] of the sea.

20.verse: You will be ·true [faithful] to ·the people of Jacob [Jacob], and you will ·be kind [show mercy/lovingkindness] to ·the people of Abraham [Abraham] as you promised to our ·ancestors [fathers] long ago.
